core-v1alpha1-AnyJSON.description: AnyJSON enhances the json.RawMessages with a dedicated openapi definition so that all it is correctly generated

core-v1alpha1-ConfigMapReference.description: ConfigMapReference is reference to data in a configmap. The configmap can also be in a different namespace.

key.description: Key is the name of the key in the configmap that holds the data.

name.description: Name is the name of the kubernetes object.

namespace.description: Namespace is the namespace of kubernetes object.

core-v1alpha1-DataExport.description: DataImportExport is a data object export.

dataRef.description: DataRef is the name of the in-cluster data object.

name.description: Name the internal name of the imported/exported data.

core-v1alpha1-DataImport.description: DataImport is a data object import.

configMapRef.description: ConfigMapRef defines a data reference from a configmap. This method is not allowed in installation templates.

dataRef.description: DataRef is the name of the in-cluster data object. The reference can also be a namespaces name. E.g. "default/mydataref"

name.description: Name the internal name of the imported/exported data.

secretRef.description: SecretRef defines a data reference from a secret. This method is not allowed in installation templates.

version.description: Version specifies the imported data version. defaults to "v1"

core-v1alpha1-Default.description: Default defines a default value (future idea: also reference?).

name.description: Name defines the field name to search for the value and map to exports. Ref: https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#selecting-fields

schema.description: Schema defines the imported value as jsonschema.

targetType.description: TargetType defines the type of the imported target.

type.description: Type specifies which kind of object is being exported. This field should be set and will likely be mandatory in future.

default.description: Default sets a default value for the current import that is used if the key is not set.

imports.description: ConditionalImports are Imports that are only valid if this imports is satisfied. Does only make sense for optional imports.

name.description: Name defines the field name to search for the value and map to exports. Ref: https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#selecting-fields

required.description: Required specifies whether the import is required for the component to run. Defaults to true.

schema.description: Schema defines the imported value as jsonschema.

targetType.description: TargetType defines the type of the imported target.

type.description: Type specifies which kind of object is being imported. This field should be set and will likely be mandatory in future.

core-v1alpha1-InstallationExports.description: InstallationExports defines exports of data objects and targets.

data.description: Data defines all data object exports.

core-v1alpha1-InstallationImports.description: InstallationImports defines import of data objects and targets.

data.description: Data defines all data object imports.

core-v1alpha1-InstallationTemplateBluepr.description: InstallationTemplateBlueprintDefinition contains either a reference to a blueprint or an inline definition.

filesystem.description: Filesystem defines a virtual filesystem with all files needed for a blueprint. The filesystem must be a YAML filesystem.

ref.description: Ref is a reference to a blueprint. Only blueprints that are defined by the component descriptor of the current blueprint can be referenced here. Example: cd://componentReference/dns/resources/blueprint

core-v1alpha1-SecretReference.description: SecretReference is reference to data in a secret. The secret can also be in a different namespace.

key.description: Key is the name of the key in the secret that holds the data.

name.description: Name is the name of the kubernetes object.

namespace.description: Namespace is the namespace of kubernetes object.

apiVersion.description: APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object. Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

blueprint.description: Reference defines a reference to a Blueprint. The blueprint can reside in an OCI or other supported location.

exportDataMappings.description: ExportDataMappings contains a template for restructuring exports. It is expected to contain a key for every blueprint-defined data export. Missing keys will be defaulted to their respective data export. Example: namespace: (( blueprint.exports.namespace ))

exports.description: Exports define the exported data objects and targets.

file.description: File references a subinstallation template stored in another file.

importDataMappings.description: ImportDataMappings contains a template for restructuring imports. It is expected to contain a key for every blueprint-defined data import. Missing keys will be defaulted to their respective data import. Example: namespace: (( installation.imports.namespace ))

imports.description: Imports define the imported data objects and targets.

kind.description: Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents. Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to. Cannot be updated. In CamelCase. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

name.description: Name is the unique name of the step
Name the internal name of the imported/exported target.

target.description: Target is the name of the in-cluster target object.

core-v1alpha1-TemplateExecutor.description: TemplateExecutor describes a templating mechanism and configuration.

file.description: File is the path to the template in the blueprint's content.

name.description: Name is the unique name of the template

template.description: Template contains an optional inline template. The template has to be of string for go template and a valid yaml/json for spiff.

description: Blueprint contains the configuration of a component

annotations.description: Annotations is an unstructured key value map stored with a resource that may be set by external tools to store and retrieve arbitrary metadata.

apiVersion.description: APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object. Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

deployExecutions.description: DeployExecutions defines the templating executors that are sequentially executed by the landscaper. The templates must return a list of deploy item templates.

exportExecutions.description: ExportExecutions defines the templating executors that are used to generate the exports.

exports.description: Exports define the exported values of the definition and its sub-definitions

imports.description: Imports define the import values that are needed for the definition and its sub-definitions.

jsonSchemaVersion.description: JSONSchemaVersion defines the default jsonschema version of the blueprint. e.g. "https://json-schema.org/draft/2019-09/schema"

kind.description: Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents. Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to. Cannot be updated. In CamelCase. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

localTypes.description: LocalTypes defines additional blueprint local schemas

subinstallationExecutions.description: SubinstallationExecutions defines the templating executors that are sequentially executed by the landscaper. The templates must return a list of installation templates. Both subinstallations and SubinstallationExecutions are valid options and will be merged.

subinstallations.description: Subinstallations defines an optional list of subinstallations (for aggregating blueprints).

title: core-v1alpha1-Blueprint
